body.p:
To His excellency Thos E Bramlette
Govr of the State of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Edwin S Grayham of Meade County would most respectfully state to your Excellency that at the present term of the Meade Circuit Court the Grand Jury empanneled and sworn returned and Indictment against him, on a charge of Keeping a tipling house. Your petitioner would state that for years past, he has been engaged in the business of selling day goods groceries &c and keeping on hand a stack of whiskey which he was in the habit of selling by the barrel only and never selling in any other way nor permitting it to be drank in the store house or on the premises with his consent or knowledge. He would further state that soon after the appointment of a deputy U States Assessor for the county he took out and paid for a whole license as a whole sale dealer in whiskey &c This he verily beleived at the time and so beleived untill the finding of the afsd indictment confered on him the right to sell and trade in the article as he chose without processing the usual license for so doing He declares most honestly and sincerely he did not know he was committing a violation of any law by selling a less quantity than by the barrel In view of the foregoing plain statement of facts he respectfully asks your Excellency to remit the penalty or fine.
Ed S Grayham says the statements on the above petition are true
Sworn to before me by E S Grayham this 2d day of April 1864
Wm Alexander P J M C

We the undersigned citizens of Meade County the above petition of E S Grayham and from our knowledge of him his honesty and integrity believe the statements in the said petition and that he would not willfully violate any known law he would further state that he is one of our best and most usefull citizens We would therefore most earnestly ask your Excellency to grant the prayer of said petitioner.

Wm Alexander Presiding Judge of Meade County.
C. C. Fairleigh D. C. Meade Circuit Court
Jno. C. Walker
Mr Graham has strictly complied with all the requisitions of the Excise tax law, and I have fully confidence in his statements made above; I cheerfully join in the petition made by him.

Edgar Needham
Asst Int. Revenue
3d Dt. Ky
Louisville May 10, 1864
I am personally acquainted with E S Graham & have been for some years & from my knowledge of him I dont believe he has knowing violated the law in reference to the mattter for which the indcitment is found & cheerfully unit in the Petition to have the penalty remitted
